queries.graphql:
query getInvoice($input: InvoiceIdentifierInput!) {
  getInvoice(input: $input) {
    invoiceId
    displayId
    client
    site
    invoiceDate
    dueDate
    statusEnum
    sentToClient
    items {
      ...InvoiceItemFragment
    }
    taxes {
      ...InvoiceTaxItemFragment
    }
    discountAmount
    additionalDiscount
    additionalDiscountRate
    totalAmount
    notes
    paymentDate
    paymentMethod
    paymentReference
    invoicePaymentTerm

}

{

      "invoiceDate": "2022-06-14",
      "dueDate": "2022-06-25",
      "statusEnum": "DRAFT",
      "sentToClient": true,
      "items": [InvoiceItem],
      "taxes": [InvoiceTaxItem],
      "discountAmount": "1250.25",
      "additionalDiscount": "1000",

    }
  }
}

fields.description: Specifies the custom field values for the client. Each entry in the JSON would be key-value. The key will be a system-generated unique name of the custom field (columnName field of CustomField type). types.name: CreateClientSiteInput
types.description: Specifies the input required to create a client site.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the site. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: working24x7
fields.description: Specifies whether the site has specific business hours or works 24x7. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: businessHour
fields.description: Specifies the business hours of the site if working 24x7 is false.

fields.name: holidayList
fields.description: Specifies the holiday list of the site.

fields.name: timezoneCode
fields.description: Specifies the site's timezone. The value should be provided using the IANA time zone database format (e.g., America/New_York). This input is mandatory.

fields.name: line1
fields.description: Specifies the address line 1 of the site.

fields.name: line2
fields.description: Specifies the address line 2 of the site.

fields.name: line3
fields.description: Specifies the address line 3 of the site.

fields.name: city
fields.description: Specifies the city of the site.

fields.name: postalCode
fields.description: Specifies the postal code of the site.

fields.name: countryCode
fields.description: Specifies the country of the site. The value should be specified as ISO 3166 two letter country code.

fields.name: stateCode
fields.description: Specifies the state/subdivision of the site. The value should be specified as an ISO 3166 state/subdivision code.

fields.name: client
fields.description: Specifies the client identifier input for the site to be created. When CreateClientSiteInput is used as part of a new client creation, this field is not mandatory; otherwise, it is required

types.name: CreateClientUserAssociationInput

fields.name: client
fields.description: Specifies the client which will be associated to the client user.

fields.name: site

fields.name: user
fields.description: Specifies the requester who will be associated. This attribute is optional when creating a new client user.

types.name: CreateClientUserInput
types.description: Specifies the input required to create client user.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description: Specifies the first name of the client user. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: lastName
fields.description: Specifies the last name of the client user.

fields.name: email
fields.description: Specifies the email address of the client user which is unique across the technicians and client users. The email will be used for login. This input should be mandatory and unique.

fields.name: contactNumber
fields.description: Specifies the contact number of the client user. It is recommended to provide the value in the standard format [+][country code][area code][local phone number].

fields.name: reportingManager
fields.description: Specifies the reporting manager identifier input for the client user.

fields.name: role
fields.description: Specifies the application role identifier input for the client user. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: addAssociations
fields.description: Specifies the associated clients and sites. The user attribute is optional when creating a new client user.

fields.name: customFields
fields.description: Specifies the custom fields values for the client user. Each entry in the JSON would be key-value. The key will be a system-generated, unique name of the custom field (columnName field of CustomField type). The value for text, paragraph, radio, select, numeric, decimal, date, datetime should be given as a string. The value for checkbox, multi-select should be an array of string.

fields.name: For example, the value could be {"udf1text": "value", "udf2mselect": ["value1", "value2"]}

types.name: CreateTicketInput
types.description: Specifies the input required to create a ticket.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: Specifies the subject of the ticket. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Specifies the description of the ticket.

fields.name: descriptionAttachments
fields.description: Specifies the description attachments of the ticket.

fields.name: client
fields.description: Specifies the client to whom the ticket is associated. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: site
fields.description: Specifies the site to which the ticket is associated. The site of the requester will be assigned by the system if not specified.

fields.name: requester
fields.description: Specifies the requester for whom the ticket is created.

fields.name: techGroup
fields.description: Specifies the technician group to which the ticket is assigned.

fields.name: technician
fields.description: Specifies the technician to whom the ticket is assigned.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Specifies the status of the ticket. The value should be from the Status (name field) type. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: requestType
fields.description: The type of the ticket.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Specifies the creation source of the ticket. This input is mandatory.

fields.name: priority
fields.description: Specifies the priority of the ticket. The value should be from the Priority (name field) type.

fields.name: impact
fields.description: Specifies the impact of the ticket. The value should be from the Impact (name field) type.

fields.name: urgency
fields.description: Specifies the urgency of the ticket. The value should be from the Urgency (name field) type.

fields.name: category
fields.description: Specifies the category of the ticket. The value should be from the Category (name field) type.

fields.name: subcategory
fields.description: Specifies the subcategory of the ticket. The value should be from the SubCategory (name field) type.

fields.name: cause
fields.description: Specifies the cause of the ticket. The value should be from the Cause (name field) type.

fields.name: subcause
fields.description: Specifies the sub-cause of the ticket. The value should be from the SubCause (name field) type.

fields.name: sla
fields.description: Specifies the SLA of the ticket.

fields.name: resolutionCode
fields.description: Specifies the resolution code of the ticket.

fields.name: customFields
fields.description: Specifies the custom fields values for the client. Each entry in the JSON would be a key-value. The key will be a system-generated, unique name of the custom field (columnName field of CustomField type). The value for text, paragraph, radio, select, numeric, decimal, date, datetime should be given as a string. The value for checkbox, multi-select should be an array of string.

fields.name: For example, the value could be {"udf1text": "value", "udf2mselect": ["value1", "value2"]}
addAdditionalRequester
fields.description: Specifies the additional requesters to be added.

fields.name: addFollowers
fields.description: Specifies the followers to be added.

fields.name: createdTime
fields.description: Specifies the datetime when the ticket was created.

fields.name: updatedTime
fields.description: Specifies the datetime when the ticket was updated.

fields.name: subSource
fields.description: Specifies the source with which integration the ticket was created from.

fields.name: sourceReferenceId
fields.description: Specifies the referenceId of the ticket in the integration the ticket was created from.

fields.name: addAssets
fields.description: Specifies the assets to be added

fields.name: suppressCloseNotification
fields.description: Indicates whether the close notification has to be suppressed while closing the ticket

fields.name: firstResponseTime
fields.description: The first response time of the ticket.

fields.name: resolutionTime
fields.description: The resolution time of the ticket.

types.example:
{
  "subject": "Help! Internet is not working!",
  "description": "I cannot access my internet! I'm not sure what's happening!",
  "descriptionAttachments": [CreateAttachmentInput],
  "client": ClientIdentifierInput,
  "site": ClientSiteIdentifierInput,
  "requester": ClientUserIdentifierInput,
  "techGroup": TechnicianGroupIdentifierInput,
  "technician": TechnicianIdentifierInput,
  "status": "New",
  "requestType": "Incident",
  "source": "FORM",
  "priority": "xyz789",
  "impact": "High",
  "urgency": "High",
  "category": "Network",
  "subcategory": "Wireless",
  "cause": "Component issue",
  "subcause": "Hardware Issue",
  "sla": SLAIdentifierInput,
  "resolutionCode": "Permanent Fix",
  "customFields": {
    "udf1text": "value",
    "udf2date": "2022-05-06",
    "udf3dt": "2022-05-06T10:10:10",
    "udf5mselect": ["value1", "value1"]
  },
  "addAdditionalRequester": [ClientUserIdentifierInput],
  "addFollowers": [TechnicianIdentifierInput],
  "createdTime": "2022-05-05T10:30:00",
  "updatedTime": "2022-05-06T10:05:00",
  "subSource": "xyz789",
  "sourceReferenceId": "xyz789",
  "addAssets": [AssetIdentifierInput],
  "suppressCloseNotification": false,
  "firstResponseTime": "2022-05-06T10:05:00",
  "resolutionTime": "2022-05-06T10:05:00"
}

types.name: CustomFieldType
types.description: The type of the custom field created by the user.

fields.name: TEXT
fields.description: The text field. The maximum length of the text value is 255 characters.

fields.name: PARAGRAPH
fields.description: The paragraph/multi-line field. The maximum length of the paragraph value is 65,535 characters. The maximum number of paragraph fields is 5.

fields.name: NUMERIC
fields.description: The whole number field. The maximum number of digits is 10.

fields.name: DECIMAL
fields.description: The decimal number field. The maximum number of digits is 10 and maximum number of digits in the fractional part is 2.

fields.name: DATE
fields.description: The date field. The date value should be specified in the ISO 8601 format i.e., 2022-08-15

fields.name: DATETIME
fields.description: The datetime filed. The datetime value should be specified in the ISO 8601 format i.e., 2022-08-15T13:15:30

fields.name: RADIO
fields.description: The radio field. The maximum length of an option value is 255 characters.

fields.name: CHECKBOX
fields.description: The checkbox field. The maximum length of an option value is 255 characters. The maximum number of checkbox fields is 64.

fields.name: SELECT
fields.description: The select/dropdown field. The maximum length of an option value is 255 characters.

fields.name: MULTI_SELECT
fields.description: The multi select field. The maximum length of an option value is 255 characters. The maximum number of checkbox fields is 64.

fields.name: RICH_TEXT
fields.description: The rich text field. used to store large formatted Text

fields.name: PASSWORD
fields.description: The password field. used to store password value.

fields.description: The client user for whom the ticket is created. The actual type of this field is ClientUser. Returns userId and name fields as JSON. The name and email fields can be used in the filter condition.

fields.name: additionalRequester

fields.name: followers

fields.name: techGroup
fields.description: The technician group to which the ticket is assigned. The actual type of this field is TechnicianGroup. Returns groupId and name fields as JSON. The name field can be used in the filter condition.

fields.name: technician
fields.description: The technician to whom the ticket is assigned. The actual type of this field is Technician. Returns userId and name fields as JSON. The name and email fields can be used in the filter condition.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the ticket.

fields.name: priority
fields.description: The priority of the ticket.

fields.description: The impact of the ticket.

fields.name: urgency

fields.name: resolutionCode
fields.description: The resolution code of the ticket.

fields.name: sla

fields.name: createdTime
fields.description: The time when the ticket was created.

fields.name: updatedTime

fields.name: firstResponseDueTime

fields.description: Denotes whether the first response metric is violated.

fields.name: resolutionDueTime

fields.name: resolutionTime
fields.description: The resolution time of the ticket.

fields.name: resolutionViolated
fields.description: Denotes whether the resolution metric is violated.

fields.name: Specifies the custom field values for the ticket. Each entry in the JSON would be a key-value. The key will be a system-generated unique name of the custom field (columnName field of CustomField type). The value for text, paragraph, radio, select, numeric, decimal, date, datetime should be given as a string. The value for checkbox, multi-select should be an array of string.

The key will be system generated unique name of the custom field (columnName field of CustomField type). The value for text, paragraph, radio, select, numeric, decimal, date, datetime should be given as a string. The value for checkbox, multi select should be array of string.

fields.name: For example, the value could be {"udf1text": "value", "udf2mselect": ["value1", "value2"]}

types.example:
{
  "accountId": "4",

  "primaryContact": ClientUserIdentifierInput,
  "secondaryContact": ClientUserIdentifierInput,
  "hqSite": ClientSiteIdentifierInput,
  "addTechnicianGroups": [TechnicianGroupIdentifierInput],
  "deleteTechnicianGroups": [
    TechnicianGroupIdentifierInput
  ],
  "customFields": {
    "udf1text": "value",
    "udf2date": "2022-05-06",
    "udf3dt": "2022-05-06T10:10:10",
    "udf5mselect": ["value1", "value1"]

}
